name: N-(4-decylphenyl)-4-methylbenzamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-2315
Reason: The compound under consideration has several functional groups that can impact its melting point. The basic unit of analysis is benzamide, which has a melting point of 100 degrees Celsius. The decyl group (C10) adds approximately +20 degrees Celsius due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. The phenyl group (C6) adds approximately +20 degrees Celsius due to increased molecular weight and rigidity. The methyl group (C1) adds approximately +5 degrees Celsius due to increased molecular weight. The 4-methyl group (C1) adds approximately +5 degrees Celsius due to increased molecular weight.
